title: Associate - Equity Financing Quantitative Trader
description:

BNP Paribas is committed to providing a work environment that fosters diversity, inclusion, and equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, gender, age, creed, sex, religion, national origin, disability (physical or mental), marital status, citizenship, ancestry, sexual orientation, gender identity and gender expression, or any other legally protected status.

title: Quantitative Options Trader
description:
Who are we looking for?

BlockTech is a fast-paced algorithmic trading firm facilitating global cryptocurrency trading while expanding into regulated markets. As we continue to grow rapidly, we are looking for a Quantitative Options Trader to join us amid our exciting scale-up phase!

What will you do?

As a Quantitative Trader in the New York office, you will be part of our brand new division, focused on trading options in the S&P 500 complex. As part of a pioneering team, we are looking for highly innovative traders who are interested and skilled in defining and fine-tuning new trading strategies and algorithms, as much as they are in operating them.

After receiving extensive training in our Amsterdam office, you will ensure our automated trading systems run smoothly in the US markets

Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:
‚Ä¢ Managing trading positions
‚Ä¢ Develop and test new strategies
‚Ä¢ Interpreting market flow and events
‚Ä¢ Evaluating trading performance
‚Ä¢ Fine-tuning automated trading algorithms
‚Ä¢ Design trading tools

You will become an expert in trading and know when and how to assist the trading system in capturing opportunities when necessary. Beyond the responsibilities listed above, you will actively collaborate with quantitative developers, software engineers, and data scientists to enhance our current trading setup and weigh in on the priorities of new projects.

At BlockTech, you will take on a lot of responsibility, with the freedom to chart your course to innovative solutions!

What is in it for you?
‚Ä¢ A full-time position in a relaxed and modern office in New York
‚Ä¢ Competitive compensation consisting of a base salary combined with a very attractive bonus plan based on individual and company performance
‚Ä¢ Outstanding performance is rewarded with the opportunity to buy into the trading fund

‚Ä¢ The opportunity to work at the forefront of automated trading, using state-of-the-art technology
‚Ä¢ Breakfast, warm lunch, snacks and drinks are provided throughout the day.
‚Ä¢ Reimbursement of your gym membership and/or other sports activities

Our culture

At our core, we are a team of passionate trading and tech enthusiasts committed to revolutionizing trading through automation. Our collaborative approach ensures that everyone contributes to achieving our ambitious goals.

In this role, you will be both challenged and stretched, with ample opportunities for growth and development, both within and beyond your main responsibilities.

We invest in our people by offering competitive compensation and benefits, fostering innovation, and celebrating success. Our commitment to personal development transcends traditional norms; we provide an equal playing field, promote reverse leadership, and offer boundless growth opportunities for all our employees.

Join us to unlock your potential and drive innovation in the exciting world of algorithmic trading.
‚Ä¢ Relevant professional work experience as a Quantitative Options Trader

‚Ä¢ Strong numerical skills

‚Ä¢ Proven versatility and ability to pick up new technologies and learn systems quickly
‚Ä¢ A positive can-do attitude and a creative mind
‚Ä¢ A sincere interest in financial markets

title: Quantitative Systematic Trader ‚Äì Master's: 2025
description:
Overview

We‚Äôre looking for quant-minded strategists who value the power of interdisciplinary knowledge and cooperative thinking. Our Quantitative Systematic Traders combine the skills of quantitative research with the knowledge of trading to develop new electronic strategies and monitor real-time performance. As a true hybrid of our core disciplines, Quantitative Systematic Traders are constantly communicating and connecting ideas between trading, technology, and quantitative research.

The general life cycle of a quant project begins with an idea:
‚Ä¢ This idea can come from anyone: you, the mentor who sits beside you, or someone you meet in the cafeteria.
‚Ä¢ As a Quantitative Systematic Trader, you will investigate that idea by immersing yourself in market data, leveraging tools in mathematics, statistics, and programming.
‚Ä¢ Through your research, you may discover a new pattern that can transform into a trading signal.
‚Ä¢ To assess the strength of that trading signal, you will run it through our backtesting environment and carefully analyze its performance.
‚Ä¢ If that signal produces profitable results, you will work side-by-side with technologists and put it into production.
‚Ä¢ Once that signal is embedded in our electronic trading strategies, you will actively monitor its real-time performance in the financial markets.
‚Ä¢ As your trading strategy evolves, you will discuss with other researchers, strategists, and traders to collect feedback and brainstorm new ideas.
‚Ä¢ Some of those ideas will turn into new quant projects, and the life cycle starts all over again.

We have a comprehensive orientation program designed to bridge the gap between academia and industry. Education topics include an introduction to options pricing, exposure to our proprietary data sets, and opportunities to practice data analysis techniques. Beyond orientation, our trading floor serves as an unlimited source of discussion for learning and development.

What We're Looking For
‚Ä¢ Master's degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Operations Research, or Economics
‚Ä¢ Solid, analytical problem-solving skills
‚Ä¢ Excellent logical reasoning
‚Ä¢ Strong communication skills in a fast-paced and/or highly collaborative environment are essential
‚Ä¢ Experience writing code to process and analyze large sets of data, especially in Python
‚Ä¢ Experience in C++ or other low level programming languages is a plus
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated interest in strategic games and/or competitive activities
‚Ä¢ Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment

By applying to this role, you will be automatically considered for the Quantitative Researcher position. There is no need to apply to both positions in order to be considered for both.

Visa sponsorship is available for this position.

The annual base pay range for this role is $250,000 + discretionary bonus + benefits. Susquehanna considers factors such as scope and responsibilities of the position, work experience, education/training, key skills, as well as market and organizational considerations when extending an offer.

If you're a recruiting agency and want to partner with us, please reach out to recruiting@sig.com . Any resume or referral submitted in the absence of a signed agreement will not be eligible for an agency fee.

title: Equity Quantitative Research | Equity Model Research | Quantitative Researcher
description:
Business: Equity Quantitative Research (EQR)

Title: Quantitative Researcher, Equity Model Research (EMR)

Location: New York

About Citadel
Citadel is one of the world‚Äôs leading alternative investment managers. We manage capital on behalf of many of the world‚Äôs preeminent private, public and nonprofit institutions. We seek the highest and best use of investor capital in order to deliver market leading results and contribute to broader economic growth. For over 30 years, Citadel has cultivated a culture of learning and collaboration among some of the most talented and accomplished investment professionals, researchers and engineers in the world. Our colleagues are empowered to test their ideas and develop commercial solutions that accelerate their growth and drive real impact.

About Equity Quantitative Research
Equity Quantitative Research (EQR) sits at the intersection of fundamental investment approach and quantitative rigor and discipline. Teams of quantitative researchers and developers work together to build and scale one of the largest equities portfolios in the market by optimizing various aspects of the investment, risk management, portfolio construction, and trade execution lifecycle. EQR‚Äôs teams are small and highly collaborative ‚Äì each member makes meaningful contributions to the research agenda and direction, and has visible impact in Citadel‚Äôs investments.

Equity Model Research
The Equity Model Research team (EMR) is responsible for the tools and analytics required for portfolio construction, risk management, and hedging of Citadel's equities portfolios. The customized risk models and hedging framework developed by EMR are central to Citadel's ability to manage our business and provide a competitive advantage to our investment teams.

Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Research portfolio construction and optimization in the context of large complex equity portfolios
‚Ä¢ Apply cutting edge computational techniques and statistical methods to solve complex problems
‚Ä¢ Build proprietary risk models for both fundamental and quant equity long-short strategies
‚Ä¢ Develop econometric and mathematical models to define stress scenarios and estimate the statistical properties of drawdowns
‚Ä¢ Leverage economic models and financial analysis to define fundamental factors driving the cross-section of stock returns
‚Ä¢ Engage with a variety engineering and research teams to implement analytics in production
‚Ä¢ Work closely with Portfolio Managers and Risk Managers to understand and incorporate risk metrics and methodologies within the investment process
‚Ä¢ Stay up to date on the latest academic and industry research and challenge yourself to continually improve and challenge the way things are done
‚Ä¢ Explore new and alternative data sources while developing a deep understanding of financial markets

Requirements
‚Ä¢ Bachelors, Masters, or Ph.D. in Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Economics or a related field
‚Ä¢ Advanced training in Statistics, Mathematics, Finance/Financial Engineering or a related field
‚Ä¢ Strong mathematical and/or statistical modeling background
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated empirical skill; comfortable with analysis of large datasets
‚Ä¢ Intellectual curiosity and passion for solving investment problems through the use of technology and fundamentals
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated interest in or knowledge of investments, including asset pricing, empirical anomalies and market microstructure
‚Ä¢ Previous exposure to a quantitative research role with exposure to equity factor models preferred
‚Ä¢ Experience using statistical packages (e.g. Matlab, R) and experience with programming & scripting languages (e.g. Python, C/C++)

In accordance with applicable law, the base salary range for this role is $175,000 to $300,000.
In addition, the employee who fills this role will be eligible to participate in a discretionary incentive compensation program,
as well as a wide array of benefit programs, such as medical and life insurance, retirement and tax-free savings plans,
and access to other healthcare programs.

title: Quantitative Developer (Affiliated Trading)
extensions: ['7 days ago', '60K‚Äì120K a year', 'Full-time', 'No degree mentioned']
description:
Kalshi is defining a new category

Kalshi has defined a new category: prediction markets. Kalshi allows people to trade on the outcome of any events and turn any question about the future into a financial asset. Kalshi fought for years and legalized prediction markets in the US for the first time in history. Kalshi is currently the fastest growing financial market in America, and has thousands of markets across politics, economics, financials, weather, tech, AI, culture and more.

We believe prediction markets have the potential to be the largest financial market because they turn anything into a financial position.
‚Ä¢ Our vision: well‚Ä¶ build the largest financial market on the planet.
‚Ä¢ Our mission: bring more truth to the world through the power of markets.

Building a new category is hard‚Ä¶ like really hard. But it‚Äôs beautiful and deeply fulfilling. Our culture is simple: we hire really talented people, work really hard, and enjoy the climb. We are looking for ambitious and exceptional people to join our (relatively small) team to help us build the next generation of financial markets.
Role Roadmap

Kalshi Trading is the market-making arm of Kalshi. It aims to provide liquidity to all the markets in the Kalshi Exchange, as well as price them efficiently. As an Engineer, you will be responsible for planning, building and maintaining autonomous systems that execute and support our market making strategies on the Kalshi Exchange. We are looking for someone with 3-7 years of experience building distributed and performance engineering systems as well as a strong understanding of theoretical trading system design. We're scaling, which means your role will evolve and grow with the company; your initial attack threads include:
‚Ä¢ Deal with large betting and sports datasets
‚Ä¢ Building sports forecasting models using game data
‚Ä¢ Using bookmaker odds data in conjunction with original modeling to generate prices
‚Ä¢ Programming ability required (Python, R, or similar languages for statistical modeling)
‚Ä¢ Experience working in the sports or betting industries preferred
‚Ä¢ Building autonomous systems that will dynamically allocate liquidity on the Kalshi Exchange, based on the outputs from the forecasting models and algorithms
‚Ä¢ Working on performance and ensuring the systems are operating reliably and with low latency
‚Ä¢ Retrieving, organizing, storing and exposing data from the Kalshi Exchange as well as from a variety of external data sources
‚Ä¢ Working with the research team to implement the forecasting models and algorithms they develop in scalable and efficient ways
‚Ä¢ Maintaining an organized record of all of the trades executed by the market maker

The rest of what the role looks like is up to you - a big part of our approach is that you get to chart your path as we grow and evolve. You will have a lot of influence in shaping what both your role and the activity of Kalshi Trading look like as we grow. There's a lot of green field to conquer, we trust that you'll make a lot of it your own :)
Our Culture

Meritocracy is at our core, and we value people who take ownership and figure (usually hard) things out. We dream big. We love our craft deeply and are proud of what we put out in the world. We are committed to our vision of building something big‚Ä¶ but also useful: a product that brings more truth through the power of markets.

Kalshians are Kalshi‚Äôs most important asset: we pick Kalshians carefully, so we trust them fully on day 1.

Commitment to Equal Opportunity

Kalshi is committed to creating a culture of inclusion and belonging, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We believe it is our collective responsibility to uphold these values and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to join us in our mission. All qualified applicants will be treated with respect and receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, uniform service, veteran status, age, or any other protected characteristic per federal, state, or local law. If you are passionate about what you do and want to use your talents to support our mission and values, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

title: PGIM Quantitative Solutions, Sr Trader, Investment VP (Hybrid)
extensions: ['13 days ago', '140K‚Äì200K a year', 'Full-time', 'Paid time off', 'Dental insurance', 'Health insurance']
description:
Job Classification:

Investment Management - Investments

A GLOBAL FIRM WITH A DIVERSE & INCLUSIVE CULTURE

As the Global Asset Management business of Prudential, we‚Äôre always looking for ways to improve financial services. We‚Äôre passionate about making a meaningful impact - touching the lives of millions and solving financial challenges in an ever-changing world.

We also believe talent is key to achieving our vision and are intentional about building a culture on respect and collaboration. When you join PGIM, you‚Äôll unlock a motivating and impactful career ‚Äì all while growing your skills and advancing your profession at one of the world‚Äôs leading global asset managers!

If you‚Äôre not afraid to think differently and challenge the status quo, come and be a part of a dedicated team that‚Äôs investing in your future by shaping tomorrow today. At PGIM, You Can!

The PGIM Quantitative Solutions (PQS) trading team is responsible for the accurate and timely execution of trades submitted by portfolio managers. Trading must be conducted in a way that meets best execution requirements expected by PQS‚Äôs investment management clients. In addition to execution responsibilities, the trade team monitors the performance of trades and trading counterparties; ensures that trades are accurately filled in a timely manner; sees that trade results are quickly reconciled and incorporated into portfolio management and accounting systems; and evaluates brokers, counterparties and trading technologies. The team works very closely with portfolio management and reports daily on trading performance and market conditions. Most equity trading involves large baskets of securities and may involve balanced, or unbalanced trades. Although the team‚Äôs primary focus is on global equity trading, it is also responsible for trading a variety of other securities around the world including a variety of derivatives and some fixed income instruments. Most trading is accomplished within a normal business day. However, this position may entail work outside of conventional business hours to accommodate trading on international stock exchanges.

What you will do:
‚Ä¢ Trading equities, treasuries and various types of derivatives (futures, currencies, swaps) on US and International portfolios.
‚Ä¢ Manage rolls of domestic and international futures contracts.
‚Ä¢ Monitor contributions, withdrawals and futures positions in equity portfolios.
‚Ä¢ Prepare baskets for agency and principal trading.
‚Ä¢ Work block trades.
‚Ä¢ Prepare detail analysis of international trades; run individual or aggregate pre-trade and post trade analyses.
‚Ä¢ Reconcile post trade performance and monitor individual broker performance.
‚Ä¢ Monitor developments affecting broker capabilities and business stability.
‚Ä¢ Monitor developments in trade execution theory and practice, including new execution venues and tools used by institutional trade desks.
‚Ä¢ Keep abreast of academic and industry literature relevant to trading.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with senior management to provide feedback on market conditions, client needs, and emerging trends to shape future offerings.

What you will bring:
‚Ä¢ MBA and/or CFA (or working towards) strongly preferred, although a BA/BS is acceptable with corresponding experience.
‚Ä¢ Minimum 3 - 5 years working in a trading capacity.
‚Ä¢ Experience with various trading algorithms and platforms.
‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of investment management processes, equity and fixed income markets and procedures/controls related to trading, portfolio accounting and portfolio administration. This includes a strong understanding of trade entry, settlement and reconciliation processes.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of international equity and currency markets.
‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of modern portfolio theory, stock market microstructure.
‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of the basics of trade cost measurement including VWAP and implementation shortfall.
‚Ä¢ Strong quantitative and analytical skills.
‚Ä¢ Some experience with computing languages and database structure is helpful.
‚Ä¢ Excellent communicator, negotiation, and relationship building skills.
‚Ä¢ Highly organized and detail-oriented.

What will set you apart:
‚Ä¢ Trading expertise in a particular investment vehicle or sector ‚Äì equities, futures, fixed income, currencies, swaps, etc.
‚Ä¢ Programming skills
‚Ä¢ Advanced skills in Excel and capable of working with large data sets
‚Ä¢ AI related training

PGIM believes in the Power of a Hybrid work arrangement. The Power of Hybrid is both the flexibility of work from home, as well as the networking and career development of in-person work with colleagues through weekly anchor day(s). This position will work a hybrid schedule in our Newark, NJ office 3 days a week.

Note: Prudential is required by state specific laws to include the salary range for this role when hiring a resident in applicable locations. The salary range for this role is from $140,000 to $200,000. Specific pricing for the role may vary within the above range based on many factors including geographic location, candidate experience, and skills. Roles may also be eligible for additional compensation and/or benefits. Eligibility to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program is subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.

About PGIM Quantitative Solutions Group Our Business:

PGIM Quantitative Solutions is the quantitative, multi-asset and liquid alternatives specialist of PGIM. For more than 45 years, PGIM Quant Solutions has helped investors around the world solve their unique needs by leveraging the power of technology and data as well as advanced academic research. PGIM Quant Solutions manages portfolios across equities, multi-asset and liquid alternatives and offers defined contribution solutions. For more information, please visit

PGIM Quantitative Solutions

#LI-CR1

#LI-Hybrid

What we offer you:
‚Ä¢ Market competitive base salaries, with a yearly bonus potential at every level.
‚Ä¢ Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurance, Paid Time Off (PTO), and leave of absences, such as parental and military leave.
‚Ä¢ 401(k) plan with company match (up to 4%).
‚Ä¢ Company-funded pension plan.
‚Ä¢ Wellness Programs including up to $1,600 a year for reimbursement of items purchased to support personal wellbeing needs.
‚Ä¢ Work/Life Resources to help support topics such as parenting, housing, senior care, finances, pets, legal matters, education, emotional and mental health, and career development.

Title: Director ‚Äì eFX Quant Strategist

Global Banking and Markets

Global Banking and Markets (GBM) is a leading Canadian Capital Markets and Investment Banking business with a growing platform in the US and Latin America, operating globally for over 100 years. Scotiabank‚Äôs strong U.S. presence provides our clients an important bridge to this key global market for trade and investment flows across the Americas and the world.

Global Banking & Markets provides a full range of investment banking, credit and risk management products and services relevant to the financing and strategic development needs of our clients. Our products include debt and equity financing, mergers & acquisitions, corporate banking, institutional equity sales, trading and research, fixed income products, derivatives, energy, foreign exchange and precious & metals. We also cross-sell the full range of wholesale products and services offered by the Scotiabank Group.

Be part of an innovative, Global Capital Markets and Investment Banking business with a unique geographic footprint that puts capital to work for our clients across industries! We work together to drive ambition for every future!

Overview:

We are seeking a highly skilled Director-level eFX Quant to join our eFX Trading desk within a well-respected international investment bank. The ideal candidate will have deep expertise in building and scaling an eFX quant trading business, with a proven track record in market-making, pricing, risk management, and execution optimization in the electronic foreign exchange space. This role requires strong quantitative, technical, and strategic capabilities to drive revenue growth and enhance the bank‚Äôs eFX trading franchise.

What You‚Äôll Do:
‚Ä¢ Build and enhance the eFX quant trading business, developing cutting-edge models for pricing, risk management, and market-making.
‚Ä¢ Develop and optimize high-frequency pricing engines and liquidity strategies to improve execution quality and profitability.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate closely with eFX traders, technology teams to drive automation and efficiency in pricing and hedging strategies.
‚Ä¢ Design, implement, and improve algorithmic execution strategies for spot FX, Forwards, and swaps.
‚Ä¢ Utilize machine learning and statistical techniques to optimize execution, reduce slippage, and improve fill ratios.
‚Ä¢ Engage with senior FX leaders to define and execute a long-term strategy for eFX quantitative trading.
‚Ä¢ Lead the development of robust transaction cost analysis (TCA) frameworks to optimize trading performance.
‚Ä¢ Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and best practices in electronic FX trading.

What You‚Äôll Bring:
‚Ä¢ Advanced degree (PhD or Master‚Äôs) in a STEM field (Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Engineering, Quantitative Finance, or a related discipline).
‚Ä¢ 7+ years of experience in eFX quantitative research, trading, or technology at a top-tier investment bank, hedge fund, or proprietary trading firm.
‚Ä¢ Deep understanding of eFX market structure, liquidity dynamics, and electronic trading workflows.
‚Ä¢ Expertise in building eFX pricing and risk models, with a strong grasp of bid-offer spread optimization, skewing techniques, and market impact models.
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in C++, Java, Python, or KDB+/q for developing real-time pricing and trading infrastructure.
‚Ä¢ Experience working with low-latency execution strategies and high-frequency trading architectures.
‚Ä¢ Strong background in statistical modeling, machine learning, and signal generation for systematic trading.
‚Ä¢ Ability to drive business growth, scale eFX platforms, and work collaboratively with trading and technology teams.
‚Ä¢ Deep understanding of regulatory considerations (e.g., MiFID II, FX Global Code).

Preferred Skills:
‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with connectivity to ECNs, liquidity providers, and internalization engines.
‚Ä¢ Strong relationships with key industry participants, including ECNs, banks, and market-makers.

Interested?

At Scotiabank, every employee is empowered to reach their fullest potential, respected for who they are and, embraced for their differences. That‚Äôs why we work to grow and diversify talent and engage employees in a performance-oriented culture.

title: Quantitative Systematic Trader | Experienced Hire
description:
Overview

Our Quantitative Systematic Traders connect ideas between trading, quantitative research, and technology to improve how trading decisions are made. As a true hybrid of our core disciplines, you will investigate ideas by immersing yourself in market data, leveraging mathematics, statistics, and programming. Through your research, you will discover new patterns that transform into trading signals, back test your results and carefully analyze its performance. As your trading strategy evolves, you will discuss with other quant researchers, strategists, and traders to collect feedback and brainstorm new ideas.

What we're looking for
‚Ä¢ Advanced Degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Operations Research or related discipline.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrate excellent analytical problem-solving and logical reasoning skills.
‚Ä¢ Exceptional communication skills, both in the ability to understand others and to make yourself clearly understood.
‚Ä¢ Experience writing code to process and analyze large sets of data, especially in Python.
‚Ä¢ Experience in C++ or other low level programming languages is a plus.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated interest in strategic games and/or competitive activities.
‚Ä¢ Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
‚Ä¢ Previous finance industry experience is not required, but a passion for financial problem sets with real time impact is crucial.

What you can expect from us:

Real Impact: Solve complex technical challenges, working alongside other quantitative systematic traders, and a highly collaborative and agile environment. Increased competence of technical skills from a blend of research, development, and trading related problems. Directly seeing how your research contributions influence trading decisions making a firm-wide impact that makes us all smarter, faster, and better every day.

Balanced, Collaborative Working Culture: Our non-hierarchical culture allows employees of every level to thrive together regardless of title or tenure at Susquehanna. With industry-leading work/life balance and a casual office environment, we‚Äôre focused on continuous development of our people in a way that works for them professionally and personally.

About Susquehanna

Susquehanna is a global quantitative trading firm founded by a group of friends who share a passion for game theory and probabilistic thinking. We have incorporated this approach into our culture, where you will find relentless problem solvers within each of our core disciplines: Trading, Technology, and Quantitative Research. From offices around the world, our employees collaborate to make optimal decisions and are driven by the desire to achieve winning results together.

What we do

We are experts in trading essentially all listed financial products and asset classes, with a focus on derivatives trading. Through market making and market taking, we handle millions of trading transactions around the world every day, providing liquidity and ensuring competitive prices for buyers and sellers. While our presence in the market is broad, our trading desks are highly specialized, allowing for a deep understanding of unique drivers of each asset class.

title: Equities Quantitative Researcher, Optimal Execution & Alpha Signals (HFT)
description:
Equities Quantitative Researcher, Optimal Execution & Alpha Signals (HFT) Location: New York City

Our client seeks an exceptional Equities Quantitative Researcher for their Alpha Capture team. This pivotal role enhances long/short equity strategies by merging discretionary insights with quantitative techniques. Focus areas include optimal execution, especially for large, multi-venue trades, and risk management. This unique opportunity applies a high-frequency trading (HFT) mindset to revolutionize alpha signal research and execution optimization.

Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Lead quantitative research to develop and implement models minimizing market impact (slippage) and maximizing fill rates for large orders across all trading venues.
‚Ä¢ Leverage HFT experience to conduct deep alpha signal research, identifying and refining signals for predictive power and profitability within an optimal execution framework.
‚Ä¢ Build innovative tools for granular analysis of client order flow and market microstructure, significantly improving internalization strategies and cross-venue execution quality.
‚Ä¢ Partner with the execution research team to refine market microstructure models, focusing on enhancing liquidity capture, reducing transaction costs, and achieving superior execution prices.
‚Ä¢ Contribute to the continuous improvement of systematic trading strategies by integrating advanced execution logic and alpha signal insights, boosting performance, robustness, and scalability.
‚Ä¢ Work with massive, high-frequency datasets, applying advanced statistical and machine learning techniques (e.g., dynamic trees) to uncover relationships and optimize trading decisions.
‚Ä¢ Recommend actionable insights and strategies to improve overall trading performance, alpha capture, and execution efficiency.
‚Ä¢ Utilize expertise to provide enhanced control and risk management over trading strategies, ensuring robustness in varied market conditions.

Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ Master's or Doctoral degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, Operations Research).
‚Ä¢ 2-5 years of systematic quantitative trading experience within an HFT firm, specifically in cash equities, with significant work on alpha signal research and large-order execution optimization.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated expertise in multi-venue optimal execution strategies and deep understanding of market microstructure.
‚Ä¢ Desirable experience with mid-frequency alpha signals or portfolio optimization techniques applied to strategies leveraging advanced execution tactics.
‚Ä¢ Strong programming skills, preferably in Python, with extensive experience in quantitative libraries (e.g., NumPy, pandas, scikit-learn).
‚Ä¢ Deep understanding of financial markets, equity market microstructure, and quantitative finance concepts, particularly relating to HFT, order internalization, and cross-venue execution.
‚Ä¢ Proven experience with or understanding of dynamic tree algorithms, or similar adaptive model structures, for predictive modeling in financial markets.
‚Ä¢ Exceptional analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills, with the ability to translate complex research into actionable trading strategies and models.

title: Quantitative Trader Internship: Summer 2026
description:

Susquehanna‚Äôs trading internship provides a distinctive opportunity to learn about quantitative trading. Splitting their day between working on a trading desk and education in a classroom setting, interns receive the best preparation possible for careers in quant trading. During their time on the trading floor, interns will be fully imbedded within a trading desk, working side by side with an experienced trader who will serve as a mentor. title: Experienced Quantitative Trader ‚Äì Delta One Strategies
description:
Belvedere Trading is a leading proprietary trading firm. We are a team driven by intellectual curiosity, seeking answers that will change not only how we trade in this technological age, but also the future landscape of the trading industry.

Our traders provide liquidity to the market through their market-making activities and are the masters of a diverse set of commodities, interest rates, exchange-traded funds (ETF), and equity index options. Traders partner with our technologists to continually engineer and optimize our trading systems to stay on top of the industry.

We are currently seeking an experienced Quantitative Trader to join our dynamic team. As a Quantitative Trader at Belvedere Trading, you will have the opportunity to build and operate trading strategies. Our traders work in a team environment, collaborating with software engineers and quantitative researchers to ensure optimal performance. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of designing and executing an automated trading strategy around delta one signals. An understanding of options market-making systems is a plus.

What you'll do
‚Ä¢ Develop, maintain, and enhance trading models, algorithms, and systems
‚Ä¢ Research new market opportunities
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with quants and software engineers to set up execution processes in various markets
‚Ä¢ Utilize Belvedere‚Äôs cutting-edge proprietary software designed by our technology team to optimize trade selections and execution
‚Ä¢ Apply a data-driven approach to trading
‚Ä¢ Use trading metrics and data analysis to identify market inefficiencies, streamline trading systems, and improve risk management techniques
‚Ä¢ Continuously contribute to the team‚Äôs investment strategies

What you'll need
‚Ä¢ Experience in electronic market making with the ability, passion, and drive to build successful trading investment strategies
‚Ä¢ Strong quantitative skills with a proficiency in probability and statistics
‚Ä¢ An ability to apply quantitative skills and logical reasoning to solve complex problems
‚Ä¢ Experience in computer programming is desirable (Python, C/C++, MATLAB, SQL)
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to perform successfully in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
‚Ä¢ Excellent written and verbal communication skills
‚Ä¢ A desire to continuously learn and proactively improve processes
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's or master‚Äôs level degree in computer science, statistics, applied mathematics, engineering, or other quantitative disciplines

$150,000 - $200,000 a year
Additionally, certain positions at Belvedere Trading are eligible for discretionary bonuses. Our employees have access to a variety of benefits, which can be found on our website here.

How We Operate - Core Values

Team Belvedere: Work seamlessly with others to achieve shared goals. Foster a positive and supportive environment that brings out the best in your teammates.

Me in Team: Focus on competing and succeeding at the highest level, constantly striving for excellence.

Own It: Actively address challenges and make decisions that drive positive results, taking ownership of both successes and failures.

Build Rockets: Bring forward bold, creative ideas and solutions. Be open to experimentation and willing to take calculated risks.

Passionate Discourse: Encourage and bring innovative, out-of-the-box ideas to discussions, actively contributing to team growth and progress.

Women and underrepresented groups frequently apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications.

We encourage you to break that mold and apply. No candidate is perfect; all have a lot to offer. We welcome your application.

Our Stance

Belvedere is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a non-discriminatory workplace. We promote diversity and equal opportunity for all employees and applicants, fostering an inclusive environment where all team members are treated with respect, dignity, and courtesy. We value a dynamic culture where diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives thrive.

Work Schedule: Regular and reliable attendance during business hours with the ability to be on-site prior to the start of business on occasion

Physical: Ability to remain at a desk and concentrate for long periods of time

Amount of Travel Required: None

Why Work Here:

Acadian is a quantitative investment firm where ideas are empowered by technology. title: Quantitative Analyst - SFG
description:
Overview

We are seeking a highly analytical and collaborative Quantitative Analyst to support our Institutional Trading business. This role is ideal for a technically skilled individual with a strong understanding of derivatives markets, particularly options, and a passion for delivering actionable insights to internal stakeholders and clients.

What we are looking for:

Excel & Bloomberg Expertise:
‚Ä¢ Enhance and maintain sophisticated Excel models that leverage Bloomberg data for real-time analysis.
‚Ä¢ Develop innovative tools and dashboards to facilitate idea generation and improve client engagement.

Quantitative Research & Analysis:
‚Ä¢ Drive the creation of Derivatives Strategy and Market Intelligence reports through meticulous quantitative research.
‚Ä¢ Conduct comprehensive statistical and scenario-based analyses to support trading strategies and market insights.

Options Market Expertise:
‚Ä¢ Examine volatility surfaces, skew, term structures, and other critical options metrics to inform trading decisions.
‚Ä¢ Stay abreast of market trends and provide interpretations of options flows and positioning.

Strategy Development & Backtesting:
‚Ä¢ Formulate and backtest options-based strategies using historical data to assess performance and risk.
‚Ä¢ Analyze the feasibility and implementation of strategies to ensure optimal outcomes.

Collaborative Efforts:
‚Ä¢ Partner with sales, trading, and strategy teams to address ad hoc requests and deliver timely, actionable insights.
‚Ä¢ Adapt to changing priorities and contribute effectively across various projects and workstreams.

Effective Communication:
‚Ä¢ Simplify complex quantitative findings into clear, actionable insights for diverse audiences.
‚Ä¢ Prepare and present client-ready materials, and actively participate in client meetings.

Proactive Contribution:
‚Ä¢ Monitor internal research and market developments to identify opportunities for quantitative input.
‚Ä¢ Take initiative to support the broader team‚Äôs objectives and contribute beyond assigned tasks.

What we're looking for

Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Mathematics, Financial Engineering, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science).
‚Ä¢ 3‚Äì6 years of experience in a quantitative role within a trading, strategy, or research environment.
‚Ä¢ Solid understanding of options pricing, volatility modeling, and derivatives markets.
‚Ä¢ Experience with backtesting frameworks and statistical analysis (Python, R, or MATLAB preferred).
‚Ä¢ Strong proficiency in Excel (including VBA) and Bloomberg Terminal functions.
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills and a client-oriented mindset.

What you can expect from us:

Real Impact: You‚Äôll be designing and reviewing systems and processes that are essential to the expanding scope and long-term goals for Susquehanna‚Äôs business..

Collaboration: Our quantitative researchers, traders and technologists work together to create competitive edge through best-in-class modeling and technical solutions.

Growth: Continuous growth and learning, with a focus on innovation and adaptability in a dynamic trading environment and regulatory landscape.

Benefits: & software engineer experience at Susquehanna International Group from technologists like you.

About Susquehanna

Susquehanna is a global quantitative trading firm founded by a group of friends who share a passion for game theory and probabilistic thinking. We have incorporated this approach into our culture, where you will find relentless problem solvers within each of our core disciplines: Trading, Technology, and Quantitative Research. From offices around the world, our employees collaborate to make optimal decisions and are driven by the desire to achieve winning results together.

What we do

We are experts in trading essentially all listed financial products and asset classes, with a focus on derivatives trading. Through market making and market taking, we handle millions of trading transactions around the world every day, providing liquidity and ensuring competitive prices for buyers and sellers. While our presence in the market is broad, our trading desks are highly specialized, allowing for a deep understanding of unique drivers of each asset class.

The annual base pay range for this role is $100,000-$200,000 + discretionary bonus + benefits. Susquehanna considers factors such as scope and responsibilities of the position, work experience, education/training, key skills, as well as market and organizational considerations when extending an offer.

Susquehanna does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or search firms. Any resume or referral submitted in the absence of a signed agreement will become the property of Susquehanna and no fee will be paid.

description: Job Classification: Investment Management - Investments A GLOBAL FIRM WITH A DIVERSE & INCLUSIVE CULTURE As the Global Asset Management business of Prudential, we‚Äôre always looking for ways to improve financial services. We‚Äôre passionate about making a meaningful impact - touching the lives of millions and solving financial challenges in an ever-changing world. We also believe talent is key to achieving our vision and are intentional about building a culture on respect and collaboration. When you join PGIM, you‚Äôll unlock a motivating and impactful career ‚Äì all while growing your skills and advancing your profession at one of the world‚Äôs leading global asset managers! If you‚Äôre not afraid to think differently and challenge the status quo, come and be a part of a dedicated team that‚Äôs investing in your future by shaping tomorrow today. At PGIM, You Can! The PGIM Quantitative Solutions (PQS) trading team is responsible for the accurate and timely execution of trades submitted by portfolio managers. Trading must be conducted in a way that meets best execution requirements expected by PQS‚Äôs investment management clients. In addition to execution responsibilities, the trade team monitors the performance of trades and trading counterparties; ensures that trades are accurately filled in a timely manner; sees that trade results are quickly reconciled and incorporated into portfolio management and accounting systems; and evaluates brokers, counterparties and trading technologies. The team works very closely with portfolio management and reports daily on trading performance and market conditions. Most equity trading involves large baskets of securities and may involve balanced, or unbalanced trades. Although the team‚Äôs primary focus is on global equity trading, it is also responsible for trading a variety of other securities around the world including a variety of derivatives and some fixed income instruments. Most trading is accomplished within a normal business day. However, this position may entail work outside of conventional business hours to accommodate trading on international stock exchanges. What you will do: Trading equities, treasuries and various types of derivatives (futures, currencies, swaps) on US and International portfolios. Manage rolls of domestic and international futures contracts. Monitor contributions, withdrawals and futures positions in equity portfolios. Prepare baskets for agency and principal trading. Work block trades. Prepare detail analysis of international trades; run individual or aggregate pre-trade and post trade analyses. Reconcile post trade performance and monitor individual broker performance. Monitor developments affecting broker capabilities and business stability. Monitor developments in trade execution theory and practice, including new execution venues and tools used by institutional trade desks. Keep abreast of academic and industry literature relevant to trading. Collaborate with senior management to provide feedback on market conditions, client needs, and emerging trends to shape future offerings. What you will bring: MBA and/or CFA (or working towards) strongly preferred, although a BA/BS is acceptable with corresponding experience. Minimum 3 - 5 years working in a trading capacity. Experience with various trading algorithms and platforms. Strong understanding of investment management processes, equity and fixed income markets and procedures/controls related to trading, portfolio accounting and portfolio administration. This includes a strong understanding of trade entry, settlement and reconciliation processes. Knowledge of international equity and currency markets. Working knowledge of modern portfolio theory, stock market microstructure. Strong understanding of the basics of trade cost measurement including VWAP and implementation shortfall. Strong quantitative and analytical skills. Some experience with computing languages and database structure is helpful. Excellent communicator, negotiation, and relationship building skills. Highly organized and detail-oriented. What will set you apart: Trading expertise in a particular investment vehicle or sector ‚Äì equities, futures, fixed income, currencies, swaps, etc. Programming skills Advanced skills in Excel and capable of working with large data sets AI related training PGIM believes in the Power of a Hybrid work arrangement. The Power of Hybrid is both the flexibility of work from home, as well as the networking and career development of in-person work with colleagues through weekly anchor day(s). This position will work a hybrid schedule in our Newark, NJ office 3 days a week. Note: Prudential is required by state specific laws to include the salary range for this role when hiring a resident in applicable locations. The salary range for this role is from $140,000 to $200,000. Specific pricing for the role may vary within the above range based on many factors including geographic location, candidate experience, and skills. Roles may also be eligible for additional compensation and/or benefits. Eligibility to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program is subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance. About PGIM Quantitative Solutions Group Our Business: PGIM Quantitative Solutions is the quantitative, multi-asset and liquid alternatives specialist of PGIM. For more than 45 years, PGIM Quant Solutions has helped investors around the world solve their unique needs by leveraging the power of technology and data as well as advanced academic research. title: Experienced Quantitative Trader - Delta One Strategies
description:
Belvedere Trading is a leading proprietary trading firm. We are a team driven by intellectual curiosity, seeking answers that will change not only how we trade in this technological age, but also the future landscape of the trading industry.

Our traders provide liquidity to the market through their market-making activities and are the masters of a diverse set of commodities, interest rates, exchange-traded funds (ETF), and equity index options. Traders partner with our technologists to continually engineer and optimize our trading systems to stay on top of the industry.

We are currently seeking an experienced Quantitative Trader to join our dynamic team. As a Quantitative Trader at Belvedere Trading, you will have the opportunity to build and operate trading strategies. Our traders work in a team environment, collaborating with software engineers and quantitative researchers to ensure optimal performance. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of designing and executing an automated trading strategy around delta one signals. An understanding of options market-making systems is a plus.

What you'll do
‚Ä¢ Develop, maintain, and enhance trading models, algorithms, and systems
‚Ä¢ Research new market opportunities
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with quants and software engineers to set up execution processes in various markets
‚Ä¢ Utilize Belvedere's cutting-edge proprietary software designed by our technology team to optimize trade selections and execution
‚Ä¢ Apply a data-driven approach to trading
‚Ä¢ Use trading metrics and data analysis to identify market inefficiencies, streamline trading systems, and improve risk management techniques
‚Ä¢ Continuously contribute to the team's investment strategies

What you'll need
‚Ä¢ Experience in electronic market making with the ability, passion, and drive to build successful trading investment strategies
‚Ä¢ Strong quantitative skills with a proficiency in probability and statistics
‚Ä¢ An ability to apply quantitative skills and logical reasoning to solve complex problems
‚Ä¢ Experience in computer programming is desirable (Python, C/C++, MATLAB, SQL)
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to perform successfully in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
‚Ä¢ Excellent written and verbal communication skills
‚Ä¢ A desire to continuously learn and proactively improve processes
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's or master's level degree in computer science, statistics, applied mathematics, engineering, or other quantitative disciplines

$150,000 - $200,000 a year

Additionally, certain positions at Belvedere Trading are eligible for discretionary bonuses. Our employees have access to a variety of benefits, which can be found on our website here.

How We Operate - Core Values

Team Belvedere: Work seamlessly with others to achieve shared goals. Foster a positive and supportive environment that brings out the best in your teammates.

Me in Team: Focus on competing and succeeding at the highest level, constantly striving for excellence.

Own It: Actively address challenges and make decisions that drive positive results, taking ownership of both successes and failures.

Build Rockets: Bring forward bold, creative ideas and solutions. Be open to experimentation and willing to take calculated risks.

Passionate Discourse: Encourage and bring innovative, out-of-the-box ideas to discussions, actively contributing to team growth and progress.

Women and underrepresented groups frequently apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications.

We encourage you to break that mold and apply. No candidate is perfect; all have a lot to offer. We welcome your application.

Our Stance

Belvedere is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a non-discriminatory workplace. We promote diversity and equal opportunity for all employees and applicants, fostering an inclusive environment where all team members are treated with respect, dignity, and courtesy. We value a dynamic culture where diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives thrive.

Work Schedule: Regular and reliable attendance during business hours with the ability to be on-site prior to the start of business on occasion

Physical: Ability to remain at a desk and concentrate for long periods of time

Amount of Travel Required: None

title: Quantitative Systematic Trader | Experienced Hire
description:
Overview

Our Quantitative Systematic Traders connect ideas between trading, quantitative research, and technology to improve how trading decisions are made. As a true hybrid of our core disciplines, you will investigate ideas by immersing yourself in market data, leveraging mathematics, statistics, and programming. Through your research, you will discover new patterns that transform into trading signals, back test your results and carefully analyze its performance. As your trading strategy evolves, you will discuss with other quant researchers, strategists, and traders to collect feedback and brainstorm new ideas.

What We're Looking For
‚Ä¢ Advanced Degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Operations Research or related discipline.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrate excellent analytical problem-solving and logical reasoning skills.
‚Ä¢ Exceptional communication skills, both in the ability to understand others and to make yourself clearly understood.
‚Ä¢ Experience writing code to process and analyze large sets of data, especially in Python.
‚Ä¢ Experience in C++ or other low level programming languages is a plus.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated interest in strategic games and/or competitive activities.
‚Ä¢ Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
‚Ä¢ Previous finance industry experience is not required, but a passion for financial problem sets with real time impact is crucial.

What You Can Expect From Us

Real Impact: Solve complex technical challenges, working alongside other quantitative systematic traders, and a highly collaborative and agile environment. Increased competence of technical skills from a blend of research, development, and trading related problems. Directly seeing how your research contributions influence trading decisions making a firm-wide impact that makes us all smarter, faster, and better every day.

Balanced, Collaborative Working Culture: Our non-hierarchical culture allows employees of every level to thrive together regardless of title or tenure at Susquehanna. With industry-leading work/life balance and a casual office environment, we‚Äôre focused on continuous development of our people in a way that works for them professionally and personally.

About Susquehanna

Susquehanna is a global quantitative trading firm founded by a group of friends who share a passion for game theory and probabilistic thinking. We have incorporated this approach into our culture, where you will find relentless problem solvers within each of our core disciplines: Trading, Technology, and Quantitative Research. From offices around the world, our employees collaborate to make optimal decisions and are driven by the desire to achieve winning results together.

What We Do

We are experts in trading essentially all listed financial products and asset classes, with a focus on derivatives trading. Through market making and market taking, we handle millions of trading transactions around the world every day, providing liquidity and ensuring competitive prices for buyers and sellers. While our presence in the market is broad, our trading desks are highly specialized, allowing for a deep understanding of unique drivers of each asset class.

If you're a recruiting agency and want to partner with us, please reach out to recruiting@sig.com . Any resume or referral submitted in the absence of a signed agreement will not be eligible for an agency fee.

title: Senior Quant Trader
description:
Who We AreAt OKX, we believe that the future will be reshaped by crypto, and ultimately contribute to every individual's freedom.

OKX is a leading crypto exchange, and the developer of OKX Wallet, giving millions access to crypto trading and decentralized crypto applications (dApps). OKX is also a trusted brand by hundreds of large institutions seeking access to crypto markets. We are safe and reliable, backed by our Proof of Reserves.

Across our multiple offices globally, we are united by our core principles: We Before Me, Do the Right Thing, and Get Things Done. These shared values drive our culture, shape our processes, and foster a friendly, rewarding, and diverse environment for every OK-er.

What You'll Be Doing:

‚Ä¢ Analyze data and metrics to measure the effectiveness of growth efforts.

What We Look For In You:

‚Ä¢ Experience in systematic trading

Applicants should apply via Okcoin and OKX internal or external careers site.

OKX is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, genetic information, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, lawful alien status, national origin, age, marital status, and non-job related physical or mental disability, or protected veteran status. title: Quantitative Trader - Equity | Miami
description:
A newly launched portfolio management team at a leading multi-manager hedge fund is seeking its first Quantitative hire in Miami. This is a unique opportunity to work directly with the PM from day one on alpha signal discovery, strategy development, portfolio design, and trading execution, with long-term potential to evolve into a Sub-PM role.

What You'll Do:
‚Ä¢ Partner closely with the Portfolio Manager to research and develop systematic strategies in the U.S. cash equity space, with an emphasis on low-frequency signals.
‚Ä¢ Build robust research pipelines and tooling for alpha testing, signal validation, and portfolio construction.
‚Ä¢ Source and evaluate novel data sets to uncover alpha opportunities tied to index rebalancing and event-driven behavior.
‚Ä¢ Contribute to the full lifecycle of strategy deployment, from research to real-time implementation and monitoring.

What We're Looking For:
‚Ä¢ 1+ years of experience in quantitative research, ideally focused on equity markets or index rebal strategies.
‚Ä¢ Advanced proficiency in Python and familiarity with statistical modeling, financial time-series, and handling large datasets.
‚Ä¢ Academic background in a quantitative discipline (Mathematics, CS, Physics, Engineering, etc.).
‚Ä¢ A collaborative mindset with the drive to build from the ground up, and a long-term interest in growing into a portfolio management role.

Why Apply:
‚Ä¢ Direct mentorship from the PM and a front-row seat to the full investment process.
‚Ä¢ Clear path to ownership and leadership in strategy development.
‚Ä¢ Strong platform support from one of the industry's top multi-manager funds.

title: Senior Quantitative Researcher - Options Market Making
description:
Senior Quantitative Researcher - Options Market Making

Maven is market-leading proprietary trading firm allocating internal capital across discretionary, systematic, and market-making strategies. We deploy Market Making strategies on listed Options and Futures on multiple exchanges globally and consistently ranked within the top three liquidity providers on the exchanges and markets we are mature in. We utilise our in-house ultra-low latency and high performant trading platforms to provide best in class pricing and liquidity to markets. Our traders are passionate about creating innovative solutions and push the boundaries of quantitative trading. We value creativity and are aggressive to capitalise on opportunities and take proven strategies to the next level. We empower our team members and maximise their ability to succeed by offering an environment that is open, collaborative and supportive.

The role:

As a Senior Quantitative Researcher, you will lead projects that have a direct impact on our trading performance. You will work collaboratively with other researchers and traders from various scientific fields and prestigious academic institutions, to develop innovative real-time trading models and solutions for low latency trading systems for exchange-traded options. You will share your knowledge and expertise with other researchers to tackle various challenging projects including but not limited to option pricing and volatility models, algorithm design and alpha research.

What we‚Äôre looking for:
‚Ä¢ Academic degree in applied mathematics, computer science, statistics engineering or physics. PhD or any other track record in conducting independent research.
‚Ä¢ Minimum 3+ years of experience in the financial industry, particularly electronic options trading.
‚Ä¢ Ability to research advanced algorithms, develop predictive models and verify complex hypotheses using large datasets.
‚Ä¢ Proactive interest in improving existing trading strategies and identifying new opportunities.
‚Ä¢ A collaborative bridge between developers, and traders who aligns technical work with commercial impact and the broader strategic vision, and a real team player with other quants in the team.

Why you should apply:
‚Ä¢ Rare opportunity to take a high level of responsibility at a fast-growing global trading firm
‚Ä¢ Opportunity to be highly involved in the decisions that shape our trading
‚Ä¢ Flexible research environment to iterate on your ideas quickly and see the impact of your work in production
‚Ä¢ Leadership opportunities as the team grow
‚Ä¢ Great engineering environment where technology, creativity and innovation is key to our success
‚Ä¢ An environment where you‚Äôre empowered and supported to achieve your ambitions
‚Ä¢ Friendly, informal and highly rewarding culture
‚Ä¢ The upside of a start-up without the associated risks

WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU
‚Ä¢ Competitive compensation
‚Ä¢ Annual discretionary bonus
‚Ä¢ Fully catered breakfast and lunch
‚Ä¢ 25 days‚Äô annual leave
‚Ä¢ Informal dress code
‚Ä¢ Private healthcare and life assurance
‚Ä¢ Group Pension plan

The Options Market Making team at Maven Securities operates under a strict direct sourcing model. We are committed to managing all recruitment activities internally to ensure a consistent and transparent candidate experience. As such, we do not accept unsolicited CVs or introductions from recruitment agencies. If you're interested in this opportunity, please apply directly.

title: Specialized eFX AI Trading Quant, Vice President
description:
Who we are looking for

This is one of two identical front office, trading floor roles with the eFX Quant Trading team. We're a friendly, collaborative, multi-disciplinary team, with diverse trading strategies across spot FX, NDFs, and swaps. The ideal people for these roles have eFX modelling experience and practical experience with applying neural nets to time series modelling.

People who lack eFX experience, but have several years of real-world experience applying neural nets to time series in any industry, or as the focus of a research degree or post-doc, are strongly encouraged to apply. Similarly people with solid quant trading experience (in FX, cash equities, or futures) and practical experience with machine learning techniques are also strongly encouraged.

The roles are for the London office, but being based in the Boston office instead is a possibility.

These roles can be performed in a hybrid model, where you can balance work from home and office to match your needs and role requirements.

Why this role is important to us

The team you will be joining is a part of State Street Global Markets (SSGM). When owners and managers of institutional assets need research, trading, securities lending and innovative portfolio strategies, they turn to SSGM business unit. As our investment research and trading arm, SSGM's number one goal is to enhance and preserve our clients' portfolio values by applying technology, optimizing trading, and linking asset classes and markets across the world.

Join us if making your mark in the capital markets industry from day one is a challenge you are up for.

What you will be responsible for

As an eFX AI Quant Trader you will:
‚Ä¢ Create profitable and robust trading signals, strategies, and models to make a significant contribution to P&L targets and eFX growth
‚Ä¢ Apply your experience with time series AI to try to solve some of our most challenging problems
‚Ä¢ Tackle modelling and analysis challenges in Market Making, Alpha, and Benchmark execution
‚Ä¢ Using public and proprietary data, identify new opportunities to generate P&L
‚Ä¢ Develop research all the way from prototype to production
‚Ä¢ Analyse the behaviours of production trading models on an on-going basis, looking for areas of improvement
‚Ä¢ Share your expert AI insights and guidance with eFX colleagues

What we value

These skills will help you succeed in this role:
‚Ä¢ Creative thinkers who are motivated by challenging (stochastic, non-stationary, non-linear, partially observed, very low SNR) problems
‚Ä¢ A firm understanding of why just throwing data at say TensorFlow libraries doesn't work
‚Ä¢ A healthy scepticism about the robustness and generalisability of in-sample results
‚Ä¢ A working habit of first investigating simpler, parsimonious models
‚Ä¢ Desire to work within a collaborative, team-driven environment

Education & Preferred Qualifications
‚Ä¢ Post-graduate degree in a quantitative discipline (engineering, statistics, mathematics, physics, or similar)
‚Ä¢ Experience of a fast prototyping language such as Python (preferably), or Matlab, R, etc..
‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of an industrial scale language such as Java or C++ is a plus

Are you the right candidate? Yes!

We truly believe in the power that comes from the diverse backgrounds and experiences our employees bring with them. Although each vacancy details what we are looking for, we don't necessarily need you to fulfil all of them when applying. If you like change and innovation, seek to see the bigger picture, make data driven decisions and are a good team player, you could be a great fit.

About State Street

What we do. State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. From technology to product innovation, we're making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we've been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading and investment management to institutional clients.

Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary by location, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans, among other perks. You'll have access to flexible Work Programs to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.

Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees' diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift programs and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you.

State Street is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.

title: Junior Algorithmic Trader
description:
Who We Are

Founded in 1980 as Aardvark Financial, TransMarket Group (TMG) is a privately held global markets proprietary trading firm in Chicago. We use next-generation technology to capture opportunities around the world and manage risk in financial markets. Our mission is to bless others through the services we provide and through the generous stewardship of the wealth we create.

TMG is a well-established and profitable business as a respected member of the global financial system for over 40 years, but also is like a startup because the potential of our group is at least one order of magnitude greater than what we are currently producing. We have an entrepreneurial culture and collaboratively develop our business with patience and discipline; we work hard, learn constantly, and relentlessly improve our expertise.

Description

Our Algorithmic Traders use their expert understanding of the financial markets and market microstructure to develop relative value arbitrage trading software and build and improve trading strategies. As a Junior Algorithmic Trader, you will have the opportunity to experience relative value arbitrage trading paired with innovative software. You will partner with Senior Traders to assist and learn all facets of automated trading. From researching and analyzing high-frequency tick data and trading performance, to building mathematical models and performing time series analysis, you will experience a deep dive into real-time trading and gain exposure to build your expertise. The ideal candidate is intellectually curious, technically analytical, and has the desire to learn and apply programming skills in a fast-paced environment (Python, C++).

Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Work with Senior Algorithmic Traders to assist and learn all facets of automated trading
‚Ä¢ Develop expertise in market microstructure, tick data, and automated trading systems
‚Ä¢ Learn and master object-oriented programming languages (C++ and Python)
‚Ä¢ Build and maintain trading quantitative model tools and analytics
‚Ä¢ Develop, code, maintain and support production quality automated trading softwares and strategies
‚Ä¢ Improve strategies and trade execution by performing post trade analyses and developing prediction models

Requirements
‚Ä¢ Pursuing a Bachelor's, Master's, or Doctorate in a technical field such as but not limited to STEM or Finance with a graduation date between December 2024 and Spring 2025 or 1-2 years pertinent industry experience
‚Ä¢ Required courses: Data structures, Probability, Statistics and Linear Algebra
‚Ä¢ Minimum major GPA of 3.5/4 or equivalent scale
‚Ä¢ Proficiency and experience in object-oriented programming languages, C++, Python and/or Java preferred
‚Ä¢ Proficiency and experience in Linux scripting are a plus
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated passion for markets, finance, and trading such as, but not limited to personal trading, participation in trading competitions, attendance at firm discover days, industry related student groups or clubs and/or prior internship experience preferred
‚Ä¢ Project or internship experience in data analysis, quantitative modeling and/or machine learning
‚Ä¢ Passion for math and software applied to markets and trading
‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of computing, math, probability, statistics, and finance
‚Ä¢ Strong work ethic and willingness to do what it takes to get the job done
‚Ä¢ Excellent verbal and written communication skills
‚Ä¢ Ability to work within a team in a fast-paced environment
‚Ä¢ This position requires physical presence and is onsite at our office in Chicago, IL

View our resources to prepare for the interview process

Benefits

We offer one of the most generous profit sharing programs in the industry because we believe our employees should be able to take part in our rapid growth and success. We are proud to offer more world-class benefits for our full-time employees and their families.

TransMarket Group is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, marital status, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected status.

title: Senior FX Futures and Spot Trader
description:
Who We Are

Founded in 1980 as Aardvark Financial, TransMarket Group (TMG) is a privately held global markets proprietary trading firm in Chicago. We use next-generation technology to capture opportunities around the world and manage risk in financial markets. Our mission is to bless others through the services we provide and through the generous stewardship of the wealth we create.

TMG is a well-established and profitable business as a respected member of the global financial system for over 40 years, but also is like a startup because the potential of our group is at least one order of magnitude greater than what we are currently producing. We have an entrepreneurial culture and collaboratively develop our business with patience and discipline; we work hard, learn constantly, and relentlessly improve our expertise.

Description

Our Quantitative Traders are dedicated to enhancing the global economy by facilitating risk transfer and restoring price equilibrium. At TransMarket Group, you'll collaborate with a team committed to eliminating inefficiencies and managing risk in the world's financial markets. As a Senior FX Futures and Spot Trader, you'll leverage the firm's robust capital base and resources to elevate your trading strategies. The ideal candidate possesses a proven track record of disciplined trading, niche expertise in FX markets, and exceptional risk assessment and management skills.

Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Utilize deep expertise in FX market fundamentals, quantitative modeling, and risk management to trade FX futures and spot instruments.
‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain quantitative tools and analytics for strategy optimization.
‚Ä¢ Manage real-time execution of trading systems, ensuring efficient trade execution.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with fellow traders to share insights and refine trading strategies.

‚Ä¢ Bachelor's, Master's, or Doctorate in Financial Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of FX market structures, including spot, forwards, and futures.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated passion for financial markets and trading.
‚Ä¢ Proficient in Python or similar programming languages for quantitative analysis.
‚Ä¢ Attention to detail with the ability to make sound judgments under pressure.
